item.title: Emergency gate left unlocked, 27th September
item.description:
Same issue as reported in Huly 2025 - gate left unlocked by the waste team & cars and vans are driving into the estate which has the potential to cause harm as people. Please can it be locked? Thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forest Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of damage needs a refurbishment, 27th September
item.description:
The park is very run down has lots of hazards with lots of holes in tarmac. Missing zipline, broken bridge and piece of spiral metal sticking out. It really needs a entire refurbishment. It's a well used well loved park would benefit the whole community it's our local park we deserve a nice safe park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The trees have not been pruned for many years and brambles have filled the space between the trees and are at a height of 10 feet high. This area s very overgrown and overhangs the footpaths., 27th September
item.description:
The trees have not been PRUNED for years and brambles have overtaken the area making it unsightly. The brambles and trees overhang the footpaths which are shed by children being taken to Harris Academy primary school at Mays Hill Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dykes Way, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
